title: [PC-4215] Balance-user - do not check limits during capture
description:
During capture the ride is already over and it does not make sense to reject the booking based on the family limits.
Instead just query family service for the owner information as the previous implementation.

This means its expected to allow users to go over the limit. Simple example is ride final price increasing and us needing to overcapture
summary: Balance-user - do not check limits during capture

title: [PC-4212] Reduce Log Level for Redis Failures When Usage Is Optional
description:
Currently, we wrap Redis operations in try-catch blocks and log warnings when failures occur. However, the RedisConnectionExecutor in the nodejs-common library throws full errors, which introduces noise in our logs—especially in cases where Redis usage is optional.

From our application’s perspective, we cannot blindly suppress these errors because in some workflows, Redis might be a critical dependency and failures must be surfaced.

Proposed Actions:
1. Contact with PINT team about possible solutions (maybe provide improvement on their side)

Goal:
Reduce unnecessary log noise for optional Redis operations while preserving visibility for truly critical failures.
summary: Reduce Log Level for Redis Failures When Usage Is Optional

title: [PC-4211] [PRELIVE] Solve "Automatic validation error" (booking_payment_collection_status_update)
description:
Context

Kibana: https://kibana-logs.prelive.elasticsearch.boltint.net/app/r?l=DISCOVER_APP_LOCATOR&v=8.17.1&%2BiCO%2F2mLigAGFpmgYIdEBovLZKCFeAAJKBqLDTbHKACMlHWA2WaigvAAkoxCAAGADsACYABzctDudnKAAsvLQAFZqVSoIxlABOeW8uXsgDMGg0VMY%2FIl7jY8rulygACVMPgkKANCFpIQGLxlJzGAB6NmUTK2vg7AlQK1QGbMoEwAooC0gYPQJBU9nRyiSfwERDyGDQbbbIA

Acceptance Criteria

  • Investigate the problem
  • Fix as possible the root of cause
  • Clean-up the MQ and errors from logs (by adding weakest validation temporary)
summary: [PRELIVE] Solve "Automatic validation error" (booking_payment_collection_status_update)

$.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comment._:
What happened:

  1. Looking at the logs, the package version is: node.package_version 26.67.0.
  2. Here’s a pipeline that goes from this version 26.27.0 to 26.120.0
  3. Changes in that release can be seen here. Notice the change in src/platform/commerce/balance_user/main/service/UndercaptureRefundBalanceAdjustmentService.ts
  4. Booking, payment
  5. The execution got to this point. capture_amount_total is null.
  6. We do sendBookingPaymentCollectionStatusUpdate and get the INVALID_PUBLISH error
  7. The invalid message doesn’t get into the MQ, but the cron keeps picking up the faulty row and so we see the error repeating

A PR with simulation of the error - https://github.com/bolteu/bolt-server/pull/136464

title: [PC-4210] NOT_EXISTS error on split response if payment method already deleted
description:
Context

Kibana: https://kibana-logs.elasticsearch.boltint.net/app/r/s/Azhal

{
  "authorization": "commerce-gateway:YG...",
  "body": {
    "brand": "bolt",
    "language": "pt",
    "order_id": 1741399489815459,
    "order_payment_method": {
      "id": "258603-300631",
      "pm_type": "business"
    },
    "order_placement_city_id": 386,
    "order_price": {
      "amount": 8.68,
      "currency": "eur"
    },
    "user_id": 101854354
  },
  "error": "BoltError: NOT_EXISTS(400)\nerror_hint: Payment instrument not found",
  "ip": "172.19.136.216",
  "response_code": 400,
  "response_message": "NOT_EXISTS",
  "type": "request"
}

We seems not need additional payment methods validation in this method in PaymentSplitService:

    private async resolvePaymentMethodForSplit(
        ctx: Context,
        paymentItem: BalanceUserInternalAsyncApi.PaymentItemResponse,
        language: string,
        userId: number,
        userType: UserType,
        brand: BrandEnum
    ): Promise<PaymentSplitItemV3> {
        const paymentInstrument = await this.paymentInstrumentService.getPaymentInstrumentLegacy(
            ctx,
            PaymentsPublicPaymentMethodHelper.toPaymentInstrumentId({
                id: paymentItem.payment_method.id ?? undefined,
                type: paymentItem.payment_method.pm_type
            }),
            userId,
            userType,
            language,
            brand
        );

        return {
            payment_method: paymentItem.payment_method,
            title: paymentInstrument.name_html,
            icon_url: paymentInstrument.icon_url,
            amount: paymentItem.amount
        };
    }

Acceptance Criteria

  • No NOT_EXISTS errors on split anymore
summary: NOT_EXISTS error on split response if payment method already deleted

description:

SF example: https://admin-panel.bolt.eu/commerce-payment/payments/3318822248

Currently we save error type/message in payment attempt only during async notification handling. Silverflow doesn’t send async notification for some error type (for example invalid input), so we need to save the error data from synchronous response
summary: Save payment attempt error data on sync call

title: [PC-4206] 25Q2 Payments Testing Tool
description:
Problem context

Using existing tooling it is cumbersome (or even impossible) to test various payment processing scenarios when for example introducing new payment methods or investigating operational issues (send authorisation for a specific amount, currency and specific meta data to PSP and then send partial refund request again with specific parameters). Currently it’s necessary to to test using real verticals, which in many cases doesn’t allow to model particular payment flows.

Impact

  • Missing possibility to properly and quickly test various scenarios leads to delays and poor quality (ie. after-go-live issues) when introducing new payment methods
  • Time consuming and at times not possibility to reproduce issues observed in LIVE when investigating payments operational issues and customer support requests

Desired outcome

Implement a testing tool that will enable PaymentsOps team to rapidly test various payments processing scenarios independently from functionality available through verticals UIs and services.
summary: 25Q2 Payments Testing Tool

title: [PC-4201] Migrate "Booking" => "Invoicing-Balance" Transfer endpoint calls from v2 to v3
description:
Booking service uses (legacy) v2 Transfer endpoint from the Invoicing-Balance service. That with (1) growing volumes and (2) switch of the Rides from Split v1 to v2 in CGW caused that Invoicing-Balance infrastructure got under pressure - in particular TiDB is heavily loaded.

Invoicing-Balance team requested whether we could migrate the Transfer calls from the v2 to v3, which (should) offer semantically the same behavior and the same interface - however internally uses more lightweight implementation (less retries).

Technically it should be simple migration, however we would have to monitor together with invoicing-balance team the integration during a gradual/staggered switch (ie. no “big bang” switch, please).

Kristjan Vedler is PoC from the invoicing-balance side to assist with the transition.

Related slack discussion: https://taxify.slack.com/archives/CNV6QPRFT/p1747049985049189
summary: Migrate "Booking" => "Invoicing-Balance" Transfer endpoint calls from v2 to v3

title: [PC-4196] Missing mapping from ProcessOut gateway to payment partner
description:
We saw the error Missing mapping from ProcessOut gateway to payment partner due to the absence of mapping of the following gateways in the mapping -

pawapay_vodafone_gha
pawapay_mtn_momo_gha
pawapay_mpesa_ken
pawapay_airteltigo_gha

The logs can be found here - https://kibana-logs.elasticsearch.boltint.net/app/r/s/yNce8

The changes needs to be done here - https://github.com/bolteu/bolt-server/blob/develop/src/platform/payment/payment_core/main/service/admin/PaymentResolver.ts#L301
summary: Missing mapping from ProcessOut gateway to payment partner

comment._:
Last 30 days:

$ elastic-cli \
--query 'node.log_tag: "PaymentResolver" AND node.log_level: "warning" AND node.log_message.keyword: "Missing mapping from ProcessOut gateway to payment partner"' \
--match "^gateway$" \
--collapse -30d | jq -cr .gateway \
| sort | uniq

pawapay_airteltigo_gha
pawapay_mpesa_ken
pawapay_mtn_momo_gha
pawapay_vodafone_gha
Added support for pawaPay.

Also need to add sandbox for PRELIVE:

$ elastic-cli --presets prelive --query 'node.log_tag: "PaymentResolver" AND node.log_level: "warning" AND node.log_message.keyword: "Missing mapping from ProcessOut gateway to payment partner"' --match "^gateway$" --collapse -30d | jq -cr .gateway | sort | uniq
pawapay_airteltigo_gha
sandbox

title: [PC-4195] Could not overcapture with Monobank
description:
We are seeing a spike of Could not overcapture errors for monobank. We need to investigate and fix it.

Logs can be found here - https://kibana-logs.elasticsearch.boltint.net/app/r/s/PIKzi
summary: Could not overcapture with Monobank

comment._:
from FF meeting:

  • We increased traffic to Monobank to 25% on the 29th. It seems it is related. Maybe we don’t need to do anything, just confirm it.

For last week:

$ elastic-cli \
--recurrent-query 'node.code_owner: "payments-lifecycle" AND node.service_id: "payment-core-router" AND node.log_message.keyword: "Could not overcapture" AND node.log_level: "warning" AND node.log_tag: "CaptureService"' \
--query 'node.service_id: "payment-provider-processout" AND node.log_message: "processOutExternalApi.capture.response"' \
--match "error_code|gateway_name" \
--collapse \
-7d \
| jq -c '
  if (.operations // [] | any(.error_code != null and has("gateway_name"))) then
    [.operations[] | select(.error_code != null and has("gateway_name")) | {error_code, gateway_name}]
  else
    (if .error_code != null and has("gateway_name") then [{error_code, gateway_name}] else [] end)
  end
' | sort | uniq -c
 405 []
   1 [{"error_code":"card.do-not-honor","gateway_name":"adyen"},{"error_code":"card.do-not-honor","gateway_name":"adyen"}]
   4 [{"error_code":"card.do-not-honor","gateway_name":"fondy"},{"error_code":"card.do-not-honor","gateway_name":"fondy"}]
   1 [{"error_code":"card.maximum-attempts","gateway_name":"dlocal"},{"error_code":"card.maximum-attempts","gateway_name":"dlocal"}]
6072 [{"error_code":"gateway.configuration-error","gateway_name":"monobank"},{"error_code":"gateway.configuration-error","gateway_name":"monobank"}]
   1 [{"error_code":"gateway.declined","gateway_name":"fondy"},{"error_code":"gateway.declined","gateway_name":"fondy"}]
   1 [{"error_code":"gateway.internal-error","gateway_name":"fondy"},{"error_code":"gateway.internal-error","gateway_name":"fondy"}]
   1 [{"error_code":"gateway.upstream-error","gateway_name":"everypaycard"},{"error_code":"gateway.upstream-error","gateway_name":"everypaycard"}]

All errors connected to monobank and gateway.configuration-error. I’ll ask Payment Ops team to take a look on this. I’ll close this ticket, as investigated.

Discussion with Payment Ops: https://taxify.slack.com/archives/C04J2SQ1TK6/p1747210109644859

We agreed to turn off overcaptures for Monobank at all: https://taxify.slack.com/archives/C08RKGV7E6L/p1747211946292639

Dynamic config change: https://admin-panel.bolt.eu/review-and-approval/requests/view/2553492
Config approved and applied to LIVE

title: [PC-4192] Postauthorisation check rely on new type property, instead of force challenge flag
description:
As per design doc we need:

Post authorisation check for cancel/proceed payment will be decided by liability_shift_status and force_challenge_type parameter.

  1. If liability_shift_status = NO}}and {{force_challenge_type = FRAUD_FORCE_CHALLENGE then payment cancelled.
  2. If liability_shift_status = NO}}and {{force_challenge_type = REGULATION_FORCE_CHALLENGE then proceed with payment.
summary: Postauthorisation check rely on new type property, instead of force challenge flag

title: [PC-4187] Elevated number of slow queries in mq_payment_instrument table [Waiting for DB team improvement]
description:
We have spikes of slow queries to mq_payment_instrument table (TiDB dashboard) a few times per week. Kibana

One of the assumptions is that we have too many stale rows in the table.

Acceptance Criteria

  1. Check if we have too many sent rows that we can remove.
summary: Elevated number of slow queries in mq_payment_instrument table [Waiting for DB team improvement]

comment._:
From ff meeting:

  • Side check: Double-check if we need to use this solution with DB MQ

Maybe we need to ask the PINT team to fix it and make it works for TiDB as well. It worked nicely with MySql.

We had to migrate away from DB publisher (for publishing of payment update and payment status update events) when migrating from MySQL to TiDB. The DB publisher was configured to publish events as-soon-as-possible as they were part of customer facing flows - ie. DB publisher was polling very often in short intervals, high amount of events and TiDB “garbage collection” when deleted records still stay (soft deleted, invisible) in DBs for some time until physically deleted, but they are still part of DB space - those caused that queries on what looked like empty tables took sometimes seconds, causing neighborood issues to other queries and even DBs on the same cluster.

Response from PINT/SREs/DBREs pretty much was that to try to achieve “near-time” events publishing through DB is pretty much non-sense, and we should go for a different mechanism.

Hence we implemented direct publishing with DB fallback. ie. we publish directly and only when-and-if the direct publishing fails then we write to DB and then publish from DB. Practically all events are published directly, the DB fallback is virtually never used (in fact).

ie. the super-high DB load caused by DB publisher is gone, no problems with slow-queries there anymore.

….

TL;DR: if “once-in-a-while” publishing of events is OK, then right approach still might be to tune DB publisher, if high-volume “near-time” publishing of events is required then go away from DB publisher.

The DB fallback for direct publisher was implemented by Pavel Melnikau - he can share additional details if required.
Slack thread with db team: https://taxify.slack.com/archives/CNKLBL33P/p1747049186871039?thread_ts=1744896204.718089&cid=CNKLBL33P

From db team: “When it comes to better approach from TiDB side, we planned to put some efforts into looking at this MVCC In-Memory Engine closer in next sprint i.e. in 2 weeks.”
https://docs.pingcap.com/tidb/stable/tikv-in-memory-engine/

I am waiting for a db ticket to link to this one.

title: [PC-4182] Cancel previous booking if payment methods on capture was changed
description:
Please apply follow patch and figure out why 100+ tests starts failing after this

diff --git a/src/platform/commerce/balance_user/main/service/CaptureBookingService.ts b/src/platform/commerce/balance_user/main/service/CaptureBookingService.ts
index 8b29e2acb1b2..6ed8da44cf6c 100644
--- a/src/platform/commerce/balance_user/main/service/CaptureBookingService.ts
+++ b/src/platform/commerce/balance_user/main/service/CaptureBookingService.ts
@@ -47,6 +47,7 @@ import {BundlingKey} from "@server-src/balance_user/table/BundlingKeyTable";
 import {SystemTypePaymentMethodValidator} from "@server-src/balance_user/validators/SystemTypePaymentMethodValidator";
 import uuid = require("uuid");
 import moment = require("moment");
+import {CancelReason} from "@server-legacy/common/booking/constants/Enums";
 import {BookingBundlingEvaluator} from "@server-src/balance_user/service/BookingBundlingEvaluator";
 
 type MultiSourceTransferResponse = InvoicingBalanceInternalAsyncApi.MultiSourceTransferResponse;
@@ -205,15 +206,36 @@ export class CaptureBookingService {
     ): Promise<PersistedBooking & StartCaptureBooking> {
         const booking: PersistedBooking | null = await this.bookingRepository.findBooking(ctx, {bookingKey});
         if (booking) {
-            await this.balanceConversionAccountService.createConversionAccount(
-                ctx,
-                booking.targetAccountId,
-                booking.currency
+            const nonBoltCreditPaymentMethods = paymentMethods.filter(
+                (pm) => !PaymentConvertHelper.isBoltCreditPayment(pm.pm_type)
+            );
+            const bookingNonBoltCreditPaymentMethods = booking.bookingItems.filter(
+                (item) => !PaymentConvertHelper.isBoltCreditPayment(item.paymentMethod.paymentMethodType)
             );
-            if (booking.state === BookingState.CANCELLED) {
+
+            const notMatchedPaymentMethod = bookingNonBoltCreditPaymentMethods.find((item) => {
+                const {paymentMethodType: type, paymentMethodId: id} = item.paymentMethod;
+                return !nonBoltCreditPaymentMethods.some((p) => p.pm_type === type && p.id === id);
+            });
+
+            if (notMatchedPaymentMethod) {
+                logger.info(ctx, "Payment methods do not match on capture with booking. Cancel old booking.", {
+                    paymentMethods,
+                    booking
+                });
+                await this.bookingService.cancelBooking(ctx, booking, CancelReason.AUTOMATIC);
                 await this.billingTransactionTable.markAsInactive(ctx, booking.transactionId);
             } else {
-                return this.startExistingBookingCapture(ctx, booking, finalPrice, businessLineTraits);
+                await this.balanceConversionAccountService.createConversionAccount(
+                    ctx,
+                    booking.targetAccountId,
+                    booking.currency
+                );
+                if (booking.state === BookingState.CANCELLED) {
+                    await this.billingTransactionTable.markAsInactive(ctx, booking.transactionId);
+                } else {
+                    return this.startExistingBookingCapture(ctx, booking, finalPrice, businessLineTraits);
+                }
             }
         }
summary: Cancel previous booking if payment methods on capture was changed

title: [PC-4177] Migrate all CGW preAuthorise endpoints to latest version
description:
Context

We used several versions of preAuthorise endpoint in CGW, it makes difficult to support all versions.

We need to migrate all clients to latest version (V6 request and V5 response).

Already implemented for Ride Hailing in this commit: https://github.com/bolteu/bolt-server/pull/123947/commits/13828198ee1c0b757288d24caa6e7834d0eda753

Acceptance Criteria

  • Only one version left (latest)
  • All clients migrated
  • All old endpoints deleted as well as all old interfaces/tests
summary: Migrate all CGW preAuthorise endpoints to latest version

title: [PC-4169] EstimateSplit Endpoints should be migrated to use 1 paymentMethod only
description:
payment_methods parameter is an array of PaymentMethods. In theory balance-user supports 1-n Payment methods but as of now it supports only up to 2. First one needing to be bolt_credit.

bolt_credit is added to the payment_methods array at commerce_gateway level based on boolean flag (that is true by default). bolt_credit is removed from the array in certain situations again on balance-user level.

AC:

  • Commerce gateway passes just the single PM to balance user in addition to the flag
  • balance-user owns the pm filtering and adding logic in one place
  • have a critical look at what we are doing with the PM list on balance-user side and adjust if needed
summary: EstimateSplit Endpoints should be migrated to use 1 paymentMethod only

title: [PC-4166] [Processout service] Delete instrument warning - Token not found on deletion, possible already deleted
description:
Kibana Logs: https://kibana-logs.elasticsearch.boltint.net/app/r/s/bnYZO

It seems we are trying to delete a processout card token twice as we have two instrument rows in our DB:

  1. Card type row
  2. Processout time row

On 2nd attempt we get error that the instrument token is not found/ already deleted. The number of just warnings are growing as we are migrating more and more processout type rows to card type rows.

AC:

  • Check with Siarhei Hlasouski if we can avoid duplicate deletion requests or not.
  • Plan a fix if there is any possible to reduce such no of warnings in logs.
summary: [Processout service] Delete instrument warning - Token not found on deletion, possible already deleted

description:
Need to provide new configuration to set up SCA rules based on issuer country and regulated countries.

As per design doc payment-core-router Authorisation service will decide upon force challenge based on:

  1. Card issuer coutnry
  2. Order country

Therefor config should map issuer country to country list.

Example

{{

{ "fr": ["ee", "fr"] }

}}

title: [PC-4161] Investigate "Could not determine instrument type of the processout transaction"
description:
Created from weekly kibanana report.

Logs: https://kibana-logs.elasticsearch.boltint.net/app/r/s/o0hgs

Number of warnings: 921268
summary: Investigate "Could not determine instrument type of the processout transaction"

comment._:
from FF meeting:

  • The issue is already gone, but it is better to investigate what the reason was for these errors

The issue was related to the payment metrics update in the scope of the task https://taxify.atlassian.net/browse/PC-3728 . The warning was introduced in PR 1 and resolved in PR 2. It did not affect the regular payment processing because we used the affected function only for monitoring.

title: [PC-4159] Unify API of split/getPayment endpoints
description:
Context

Started from task: https://taxify.atlassian.net/browse/PC-4113

Continued in Slack thread: https://taxify.slack.com/archives/C02L9EMP4TE/p1745927003342379

TLTR: We have three fields inside Split V2 response (no one used these):

  • debt
  • unpaid_amount
  • excess

Also getPayment endpoint have similar output (doc).

What we need to do

  1. Make both API similar and document it
  2. Teach all clients of split V2 to use fields correctly, or remove it from payload and calculation
  3. Validate getPayment behaviour and compare to split calculation. This should work same way.
summary: Unify API of split/getPayment endpoints

comment._: Alexey Efimov … Split topic is a good candidate for the tech forum, let’s discuss it incl. this ticket next week on Tuesday (May 27).

title: [PC-4156] Change apm/tokenization/complete request structure
description:
Processout team is going to release changes in the request body for apm/tokenization/complete , which will remove invoice_id and add customer_id . Paypal tokenization flow does not rely on invoice id in that endpoint, however this endpoint reuses ApmConfirmSuccessRequestQuery where invoice_id is mandatory.

TBD

Before PO release their changes, we need to create a separate interface to fit into the new PO request structure.

export interface ApmTokenizationCompleteRequestQuery {
    /**
     * JWT token we have attached to the redirect URL
     */
    token: tString<1, 512>;
    data: tString<1, 2048>;
    country?: tString<2, 2>;
    customer_id?: tString<1, 128>;
}

https://taxify.slack.com/archives/C010VCJ4T3Q/p1745403867366429
summary: Change apm/tokenization/complete request structure

title: [PC-4154] Capture Booking endpoint should only support 1 payment method.
description:
BookingCaptureRequestIdempotencyKeyV4 payment_methods parameter is an array of PaymentMethods. In theory balance-user supports 1-n Payment methods but as of now it supports only up to 2. First one needing to be bolt_credit.

bolt_credit is added to the payment_methods array at commerce_gateway level based on use_balance flag (that is true by default). bolt_credit is removed from the array in ceratin situations again on balance-user level.

AC:

  • Commerce gateway passes just the single PM to balance user in addition to the balance_user flag
  • balance-user owns the pm filtering and adding logic in one place
  • have a critical look at what we are doing with the PM list on balance-user side and adjust if needed
  • Plus points: please rename BookingCaptureRequestIdempotencyKeyV4 to something that makes sense as it is not actually an idempotency key but just request body
summary: Capture Booking endpoint should only support 1 payment method.

description:
Slack discussions: https://taxify.slack.com/archives/C07SLDAHLF6/p1745564977880509

When user has a family and an instrument is attach to a family as default family instrument, upon deletion of instrument view force_delete we don’t delete the family default instrument reference. This causes confusion on the family view as the instrument is still visible there but the actual status of the instrument is DELETED.

AC:

  • Remove/ delete family default instrument reference(s) when user deletes an instrument with force_delete functionality
  • Updated tests
summary: Instrument - Delete family default instrument reference

title: [PC-4151] Add client-commerce-proxy endpoints support for delivery auth router
description:

Common endpoints called from PCI:

/payment/instrument/addCardInstrument
/user/v2/pciSupport/findCardInstrumentId

title: [PC-4149] [Prelive] payment row with chargeback status is not correctly displayed
description:
On admin payments page, the payment rows with chargeback don’t have correct chargeback status for few payments.

Below picture shows list of topups with incorrect status (not all but few).

Example (payment status is chargedback in detail view): https://admin-panel.prelive.bolt.eu/commerce-payment/payments/1815675147

AC:

  • Investigate the cause of such behaviour
  • Fix the issue either in Admin or in the backend.
summary: [Prelive] payment row with chargeback status is not correctly displayed

comment._:
from FF meeting:

  • we might have the same issue on LIVE, but we didn’t try to do chargebacks in LIVE

We can receive 5 types of chargebacks from the PO. We update the payment attempt status only when we receive TRANSACTION_CHARGEBACK_CREATED. In the example above, we received only TRANSACTION_CHARGEBACK_LOST. In this case, we only publish another chargeback event from the payment-core and don’t update payment attempts statuses. We are showing payment attempt states on the admin-panel payments listing page from the database.
Payment attempt status calculator also uses payment action logs to show payment attempts statuses on the payment page, which are not present on the listing page.

I checked the wrong payment, and Muhammad Irfan showed that we received the same webhook TRANSACTION_CHARGEBACK_CREATED in both cases. Further investigation showed that we processed the chargeback notification before capture (initial capture update to captured state failed).

title: [PC-4147] Check method availability for default instruments
description:
We have availability in place during :

  1. Instruments list retrieval (listWithBalanceData)
  2. During payment processing (internal/authorise)

However, availability check can be bypassed if:

  1. User had preselected default instrument (lets say business)
  2. Instrument type (business) is being disabled for a specific country (lets say Georgia) and flow (lets say rentals)
  3. User still able to use default instrument, since user doesn’t land to instrument selection page, with filtered instruments
  4. We do not own business payment processing, therefore can’t do checks there. (Already fixed by business side)

We might think of possibility to apply availability checks based on our configuration (business availability polices as well maybe) and hard reject a request for default instrument (NOT_FOUND).

Initial thread
summary: Check method availability for default instruments

comment._:
from PI meeting:

  • we check payment instrument availability when we are requesting the list of Default payment instruments, but we don’t check it when we are requesting a default payment instrument. It seems that it should be fixed
  • Also before doing the fix, the new behaviour should be discussed with PM and Vertials, who use this endpoint.

title: [PC-4137] [Chargeback events] Add cards data into chargeback event interface
description:
Currently we pass & process instrument data during chargeback notification different for processout and silverflow services.

Processout charegback event processing:

We get the card data form event payload (as JSON) and parse it to get card data.

 const parsedPayload = this.parsePayload<PartialProcessoutPayload>(ctx, event.event.payload);
 const instrumentMetadata = parsedPayload?.data.transaction?.card;
 
 ...
 
  payment_instrument: {
              metadata: {
                  created_at: instrumentMetadata?.created_at ?? undefined,
                  scheme: instrumentMetadata?.scheme ?? undefined,
                  iin: instrumentMetadata?.iin ?? undefined,
                  last_4_digits: instrumentMetadata?.last_4_digits ?? undefined,
                  fingerprint: instrumentMetadata?.fingerprint ?? undefined,
                  country_code: instrumentMetadata?.country_code ?? undefined,
                  exp_year: instrumentMetadata?.exp_year ?? undefined,
                  exp_month: instrumentMetadata?.exp_month ?? undefined,
              },
          },

Silverflow chargeback event processing:

We get the instrument details from payment-instrument endpoint and use the data to enrich the chargeback payload. 

  const paymentInstrument = await this.getPaymentInstrument(ctx, paymentInstrumentId, paymentUser);
  
  ...
  
  payment_instrument: {
              metadata: this.extractInstrumentMetadata(ctx, paymentInstrument),
          },

Two different issues to fix:

  1. Can we keep the both implementations same?
    1. May be we don’t have the instrument data in silverflow, that’s we are getting it form payment-instrument endpoint.
  2. Removal of event JSON payload for processout chargeback
    1. Either we get the instrument data same way as silverflow
    2. Or we update the processout chargeback event interface with card block instead of passing JSON payload (its heavy and long, and only card block is used out of it)
summary: [Chargeback events] Add cards data into chargeback event interface

title: [PC-4134] [payment-provider-processout] Set custom timeout values for each API
description:
Currently from ProcessOutExternalApi we have set the default timeout of 10 sec for all API endpoints, while processout has their default timeout more than 10 sec (30 sec, even more with some PSPs). Due to this 10 sec timeout we get a lots of timeouts and our systems are retrying those operations and we are also getting extra alerts & logs. Some operations are time critical (e.g. authorize or confirm wallets) where user is waiting for the confirmation of the payment to start the order, while some are not time critical (e.g. cancel refund, capture) and users are not waiting for the operation completion (final result).

AC:

  • Analyze the possibility of setting a different timeout for different API endpoints
    • Authorize → 10 sec
    • Capture → 30 sec
    • Cancel → 30 sec
    • Refund → 30 sec
    • others → custom values
  • If setting is possible then adjust the code within payment-provider-processout service and caller services (e.g. payment-core, booking, etc.)

Expected Results:

  • Less no of alerts and timeout errors in logs for some operations (cancel, refund, capture, etc.)
summary: [payment-provider-processout] Set custom timeout values for each API

comment._:
from PI meeting:

  • After changes, monitor memory and CPU carefully. We will keep more connection open, it probably will affect CPU usage or memory consumption
  • We should start with cancel calls because we have issues with it, then refunds, and then remaining

title: [PC-4132] [PCI] Add support of delivery app auth for Add Card
description:
User Authentication Platform team is working on introducing two types of authentication (Basic User, JWT) support for client apps (delivery and rider). Currently we support on UserAuthRouter in payments backend (client-commerce-proxy) and on PCI which is only for rider client apps and delivery app will have another auth router specifically for the delivery apps.

Backend PR with changes in client-commerce-proxy: https://github.com/bolteu/bolt-server/pull/133522

Petr Reshetnikov did he initial changes in PCI repo but could not add due to access restrictions on PCI, code changes in below link:

https://files.slack.com/files-pri/T049H2DT1QQ-F08PUBURD96/pci.diff

What changes are required on PCI?

  1. Add support of Delivery UserAuth Router for /AddCard endpoint
    1. Proposal is to create similar copy of /addCard for delivery
    2. Evaluate the proposal and explore if other options are there to get app type from the payload or as new param
  2. Connect to the relevant endpoint of client-commerce-proxy (above PR adds separate endpoints for delivery) from PCI add card and pass authentication data
  3. Add test coverage
  4. Check with InfoSec/ Security about the solution/ changes in PCI

Options how to detect the source app:

  1. checking the available auth data with PCI and determine the app (rides, delivery)
  2. passing extra param source : "delivery" | "rides" into the addCard request interface
  3. [Proposal from Petr] adding specific endpoint for delivery apps /eater/addCard

Final solution:

  • We have existing version filed in the add card request and we will use this filed to detect the app type and call the relevant backend endpoint.
summary: [PCI] Add support of delivery app auth for Add Card

comment._:
from PI meeting:

  • If we decide to go with another endpoint in PCI, discuss it with Siarhei Hlasouski he will help to arrange discussions with the right people from SRE. Also, it should be discussed with Infosec to make sure that we can introduce a new endpoint. And it should be added to the next PCI audit.
PCI internal API calls with Bolt backend and deployment guideline documents are coming soon.

title: [PC-4130] Migrate commerce-payment-web, commerce-balance-webview, pci-payments  CI/CD pipeline to unicorn builder/GH Actions
description:
We would like to migrate from custom Jenkins pipeline to standardised PINT supported tooling.Multiple options have surfaced during informal discussions between Engineering / PINT / SRE, including:

  1. Unicorn Builder
  2. GitHub Actions + Cloudflare Pages
  3. GitHub Actions + S3 Static Pages

Engineering preference would be Unicorn Builder as to have unified experience with bolt-server & admin-panel, but we lack knowledge of 2&3 / feature comparison.After migration of commerce-payment-web, we’d like to repeat this for other Commerce webapps and possibly (to-be-created) PCI frontend.

PINT ticket: https://taxify.atlassian.net/browse/PIF-1995

They promised to allocate time for this in April-May 2025

Progress

  1. [ DONE ] commerce-payment-web was migrated to Builder
  2. [ WIP ] commerce-balance-webview: NodeJS migration to v22
summary: Migrate commerce-payment-web, commerce-balance-webview, pci-payments  CI/CD pipeline to unicorn builder/GH Actions

title: [PC-4128] Fail Refund Attempt in case of Chargeback
description:
For this payment, the following happened -

  • CS tried to do partial refund
  • It failed
  • Retry mechanism kicked in
  • Chargeback happened
  • Retry is now failing continuously as the state is now chargedback
  • We throw this exception

We need to handle such cases, stop retrying of the partial refund in such cases.

Also, here is the error log for the failure - https://kibana-logs.elasticsearch.boltint.net/app/r/s/FnV3A
summary: Fail Refund Attempt in case of Chargeback

comment._:
From FF meeting:

  • Rushang Chauhan to add details to the ticket. He discussed the solution with Alexey Efimov. And hand it over to Siddharth Verma
  • discuss the solution with fraud team to make sure that they are ok with it
